intro: Heptapleurum samoense, commonly known as the Samoan heptapleurum, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree. The plant features compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural cultivation in tropical regions.
